main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified aerial objects were reported in Corvallis, Oregon, on various dates in November 1954, including sightings by a college professor, a civilian family, and several other witnesses.
interesting points: A civilian college professor observed a luminous object of changing color with the ability to bend and change direction, which defied explanation.
Several residents witnessed circular, silver-colored objects flying at a high altitude and speed, reflecting sunlight, and maintaining a constant speed and trajectory.
The objects observed by Mr. and Mrs. L. M. Jones and their children were described as bright, round, and unlike any known aircraft, moving silently before disappearing from view.
No sound was heard from the objects, and no evasive action was observed, indicating unusual behavior.
The sightings occurred in clear weather conditions with unlimited visibility, enhancing the credibility of the witnesses.
sighted object: unidentified aerial objects, including luminous and color-changing objects, circular silver-colored objects, and bright, round, silent objects
witnesses: civilian college professor, several residents including Mr. and Mrs. L. M. Jones and their children
photographs: no photographs were included in the report
